reference.shortdesc: In a lcMultipleSelect2 interaction, the learner must indicate two or more correct answers from a list of choices.This element replaces the lcMultipleSelect element in DITA 1.2.

example.title: Example
example.codeblock: <!--Multiple select Interaction --> <lcMultipleSelect2> <lcInteractionLabel2>Finding Major League Baseball logos</lcInteractionLabel2> <lcQuestion2>Which one of the following is a logo of a Major League Baseball team? (You may choose more than one.)</lcQuestion2> <lcAnswerOptionGroup2> <lcAnswerOption2 id="A"> <lcAnswerContent2> <image href="logo1.gif"/> </lcAnswerContent2> <lcCorrectResponse2/> <lcFeedback2>Yes, that's one.</lcFeedback2> </lcAnswerOption2> <lcAnswerOption2 id="B"> <lcAnswerContent2> <image href="logo2.gif"/> </lcAnswerContent2> <lcCorrectResponse2/> <lcFeedback2>Yes, that's one.</lcFeedback2> </lcAnswerOption2> <lcAnswerOption2 id="C"> <lcAnswerContent2> <image href="logo3.gif"/> </lcAnswerContent2> <lcFeedback2>No, not that one. Sorry!</lcFeedback> </lcAnswerOption2> <lcAnswerOption2 id="D"> <lcAnswerContent2> <image href="logo4.gif"/> </lcAnswerContent2> <lcCorrectResponse2/> <lcFeedback2>Yes, that's one.</lcFeedback2> </lcAnswerOption2> </lcAnswerOptionGroup2> </lcMultipleSelect2>
